choices.name: Use effective research methods for your French ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research strategies. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Learn about French genealogy in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: France Genealogy

  2. Beginning: Learn about beginning French research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Beginning Research in France, Part 1—17:48 - 2011

  3. Here are tips for starting your French research.

    ☆ TH—How to Research French Ancestry - 2018
    ☆ FS—Finding Your French Ancestors - 2020

  4. Learn more about doing French research in these articles from Price Genealogy.

    ☆ PR—France Genealogy Research – Part One
    ☆ PR—France Genealogy Research – Part Two

  5. Paris: Learn about doing research in Paris.

    ☆ FS—Out of the Ashes of Paris—53:11 - 2017

  6. Corsica: Here are some resources for genealogy in Corsica.

    ☆ Understanding France: Corsica - 2022

resources.description: FamilySearch and Ancestry: Learn about resources for French research on FamilySearch and Ancestry.

links.text: Your Guide to Finding Your French Ancestors

resources.description: Explore a variety of resources on the FreeFrenchAncestry site.
Explore the FrancoGene site, which also has French-Canadian resources.
Explore French genealogy resources on the
Correspondence: Use this guide for corresponding with French organizations about genealogy resources.

choices.name: Learn about records for research in France.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Record Finder: Use the France Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: France Record Finder

  2. History and Records: Learn about the impact of French history and culture on available records.

    ☆ FS—French History and Records for Genealogy - 2020

  3. Sites: Learn about using FranceGenWeb to access French records online.

    ☆ FS—Finding French Ancestors Online, Part 2—60:01 - 2017

  4. Learn about using Geneanet to access French records online.

    ☆ FS—Finding French Ancestors Online, Part 3—46:51 - 2017

  5. Explore the Filae site for research records.
  6. Learn more about using Filae for research.

    ☆ BYU—Filae—10:24



  7. Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.

content.text:
Language and Terms
  1. Alphabet: Learn about the French alphabet.

    ☆ FS—French Handwritten Records, Lesson 1—25:00

  2. Words & Phrases: Learn about key words and phrases in French.

    ☆ FS—French Handwritten Records, Part 2—25:00

  3. Reading Records: Learn more about reading French records.

    ☆ FS—Beginning Research in France, Part 3—30:00

  4. Language & Terms: Learn about the French language and genealogy terms in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: French Language
    ☆ AC—French Genealogy Terms

  5. French & Latin: Learn about reading records in French and Latin.

    ☆ FS—France Research With the Wiki Part 5 of 8: Reading Records in French and Latin—30:00


Language and Terms
Handwriting
  1. Learn French paleography in this BYU Script Tutorial.
  2. Explore this online paleography course to learn to read old French handwriting.

choices.name: Learn about surname research in France.

content.text:
1. Surnames: Learn about researching French surnames.

    ☆ AF—What You Need to Know About French Surnames—8:01



  2. Explore ☆surname distribution (a map where certain surnames are prevalent) in France.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: French Names
    ☆ TH—French Surnames

  4. Search the ☆Geneanet site for French surnames.

  5. Search for French surnames in a number of databases.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about France archives and libraries.
summary: Explorations

choices.name: Learn about France archives and libraries.

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Learn about French archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: France Archives and Libraries

  2. See also the Miscellaneous Archives and Libraries section of the article.
  3. Resources: Learn about selected French archives and libraries in the French Genealogy Blog.
  4. Find out about resources in French archives in these Legacy Tree articles.

    ☆ LT—Guide to French Genealogy & Family History Resources
    ☆ LT—Inside the French National Archives

  5. Department Archives: Watch this video to learn about using Department Archives in France.

    ☆ FS—France Research With the Wiki Part 4 of 8: Using France Department Archives Online—6:00

  6. Books We Own: Explore the ☆Books We Own site for books that can be checked out or researched for you by others.
  7. More: Learn more about archives and libraries in France.

    ☆ RT—French Ancestors? There Is More Than the Civil Status! Part 1 of 2—15:24 - 2021


    ☆ RT—French Genealogy: The Archives Départementales are Free Online—14:35 - 2021

content.text:

  2. Search French newspapers in the ☆onlinenewspapers.com site.
  3. Search French newspapers in the ☆world-newspapers.com site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for French research.

content.text:
1. Explore links in the FamilySearch Wiki.
  2. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in the ☆Thoughtco site.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for France.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the FamilySearch page for French online record collections
  4. Explore the Europe page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your France research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆French Genealogy Facebook page.
  2. Visit the ☆Genealogie page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆France Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the ☆Southern Europe Genealogy Research Community page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for France.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for France research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community to read or post questions about French ancestors.
  2. Explore the ☆France research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about France research.
  4. Explore France research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

choices.name: Learn about France genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about France genealogy societies in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

  2. Explore the ☆American-French Genealogical Society site.

  3. Explore the ☆France genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.

  4. Get help at a family history center in France.
